channel.title: linux on Yuvi Panda

item.title: learning selinux and apparmor
item.description: I am trying to understand SELinux and AppArmor, and collecting resources here as I learn. k SELinux for mere mortals (2014) This was the first video I watched, and it helped me understanding what SELinux does at a fundamental basic level. It’s probably useless in a container-filled world (where I doubt Fedora shipes pre-configured SELinux rules for my containers), but it helped me think I understood types / labels, so that seems like a positive step?
